ground_truth: Wearing a white dressing gown, he sits on the bed in his hotel room. He takes a wedding invitation from an envelope and studies it. Ryan picks up his BlackBerry and reads a text from Alex. Ryan smiles and replies. Alex reads the reply. Alex grins and writes back. Ryan stares at his BlackBerry. Alex looks at her BlackBerry. Ryan reads it. Natalie lines up a photograph. Ryan holds the cardboard cut-out of Julie and Jim in front of the main terminal building at St. Louis Airport. A row of grand glass-fronted arches. Ryan moves closer. Ryan looks fed up. Natalie takes the picture. She hands over the camera. She walks off. Ryan is incredulous. Wichita. Ryan and Natalie sit with a young man in a conference room. He grabs the strategy packet, shoves the chair over, and storms out. A young woman. Ryan follows Natalie outside. She sits on a bench. He stands facing her. She looks disturbed. She nods. Concerned, Ryan frowns. She nods stiffly. An American Airlines jet taxis. The silver jet with red, white, and blue liveries speeds along the runway and takes off. Rows of houses in suburbia. Kansas City. Ryan and Natalie walk into a large open-plan office which has already been cleared, apart from a few chairs and a couple of desks. The receptionist looks up at Natalie and Ryan tearfully. Natalie scans the bare office, looking slightly uncomfortable. Another flight. Tulsa. In a hotel lobby, Ryan stands waiting as Natalie talks on her phone. Ryan frowns and turns sharply to look in a mirror. Ryan and Natalie sit in separate offices with various employees who look at their strategy packets. Outside a hotel room with Alex, Ryan tries one of his cards in the door slot. It doesn't work, so he tosses it away. He tries another and opens the door. They go in. A jet takes off. On the flight, Ryan hands Natalie an American Airlines Priority Access application form and a pen. She tentatively takes them. A wide river runs through a city. Ryan and Natalie meet several employees. An old guy lets out a short breath. Ryan finds Natalie sitting in a room crammed full of office chairs. She gets up, holding her coat. They walk out past a car rental office. A few, small clouds float in the clear sky above Miami, set against the deep, blue ocean. A jet comes in to land. Ryan gives a motivational talk. Natalie stands at the back of the conference room, watching. He smiles thoughtfully. In a corridor, Ryan chats with a couple of delegates. Natalie looks up from her cell phone, shocked. Natalie looks over at Ryan. They sit facing each other on the Hilton shuttle bus.

In a hotel foyer, Ryan stands observing as Natalie chats on her device. Ryan scowls and pivots abruptly to peer in a window. Ryan and Natalie sit in separate rooms with various associates who study their action plans. Outside a suite with Alex, Ryan tries one of his passes in the slot. It fails, so he flicks it away. He tries another and unlocks the entrance. They step inside. A plane lands. During the trip, Ryan hands Natalie a Delta Airlines Gold Membership request form and a pencil. She hesitantly accepts them. A long bridge spans a city. Ryan and Natalie encounter several associates. An elderly man exhales a deep sigh. Ryan discovers Natalie lounging in a chamber filled with armchairs. She rises, clutching her scarf. They stroll out past a bike rental station. A few, small kites soar in the bright sky above Miami, set against the vast, turquoise sea. A plane dives to land. Ryan delivers an inspiring speech. Natalie hovers at the back of the seminar room, observing. He grins reflectively. In a hallway, Ryan converses with a pair of attendees. Natalie glances up from her smartwatch, astonished. Natalie glances over at Ryan. They sit opposite each other on the Marriott airport shuttle.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Dressed in a yellow spacesuit, the elephant lounges on the hammock in its garden shed. The elephant pulls a birthday card from a shoebox and examines it. Boris grabs his calculator and deciphers a riddle from Jessie. Boris chuckles and decodes. Jessie interprets the response. Jessie giggles and deciphers again. Boris glares at his calculator. Jessie glances at her calculator. Boris interprets it. Melody frames a sketch. Boris clutches the rubber replica of Zoe and Tim beside the main barn structure at Denver Station. A sequence of grand metallic-clad columns. Boris drifts nearer. Boris appears bored. Melody captures the sketch. She transfers the sketchpad. She strolls away. Boris is baffled. Reno. Boris and Melody sit with an elderly woman in a meeting space. She snatches the recipe booklet, nudges the sofa aside, and stomps away. An old man. Boris trails Melody outdoors. She perches on a stump. He stands across from her. She appears troubled. She agrees. Worried, Boris grimaces. She agrees reluctantly. A freight train chugs. The rusty locomotive with multicolored graffiti races down the tracks and vanishes. Rows of trees in the countryside. Boulder City. Boris and Melody stride into a small cubicle office which is mostly empty, apart from several potted plants and a couple of tables. The janitor glances up at Melody and Boris sorrowfully. Melody examines the sparse office, feeling mildly awkward. Another journey. Tucson. In a motel lounge, Boris waits as Melody debates on her tablet. Boris grimaces and spins abruptly to gaze into a window. Boris and Melody sit in different booths with several clients who analyze their recipe booklets. Outside a cabin room with Jessie, Boris attempts one of his keys in the lock slot. It fails, so he flings it aside. He attempts another and unlocks the entryway. They wander inside. A train departs. On the journey, Boris presents Melody with a Delta Airlines Frequent Flyer membership sheet and a pencil. She hesitantly accepts them. A winding path meanders through a town. Boris and Melody encounter numerous clients. An elder woman exhales a quick sigh. Boris discovers Melody sitting in a space packed full of swivel chairs. She rises, lifting her scarf. They march out past a bicycle rental shop. A handful of fluffy sheep graze in the green meadow beyond Portland, against the vast, azure sea. A train descends to a halt. Boris delivers an inspirational speech. Melody stands at the rear of the lecture hall, observing. He grins pensively. In an alleyway, Boris converses with a group of attendees. Melody peers up from her gadget, startled. Melody glances over at Boris. They sit opposite each other on the Marriott ferry bus.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: In his hotel room, Ryan, wearing a white gown, examines a wedding invitation and exchanges texts with Alex, making them both smile. At the St. Louis Airport, Ryan holds a cardboard cut-out while Natalie takes a picture, and they proceed to a conference room in Wichita, where a young man storms out after grabbing a strategy packet. Outside, Natalie looks disturbed, and Ryan, concerned, frowns. They travel to Kansas City and find a nearly empty office where a receptionist glances tearfully at them. In Tulsa, Ryan waits as Natalie uses her phone in a hotel lobby, then they meet employees individually. Later, they enter a room with Alex after some difficulty with the key card. On a flight, Ryan gives Natalie a Priority Access form, which she accepts hesitantly. In Miami, Ryan delivers a motivational talk observed by Natalie, who stands at the back. Ryan later chats with delegates and silently exchanges glances with a shocked Natalie. They sit across from each other on a Hilton shuttle bus.
